primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The movement from the absurdity of death and historical violence toward a 'holding on' to the idea of love's solidarity, exemplified by Simone Weil and Jesus.

subject.identificatie: The 'I' (Preacher/Hearer) and 'Love' as an abstract force.
tekstueel_bewijs: Ich versuche, mich diesem Gedanken mithilfe einer Geschichte zu nähern
Ich halte mich an die Wahrheit
Ich jedenfalls kann mich da nicht entscheiden

object.identificatie: Meaning/Solidarity/Orientation in the face of death.
tekstueel_bewijs: Dinge... die wir zum Leben brauchen
die Liebe gegen den Tod zu setzen
gegen das Meer von Tränen und Foltern
was könnten wir vom Tod eines anderen haben?
damit ich mich daran halten kann
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: Does hearer identify with Subject or Receiver?

tekstueel_bewijs: Wir hüllen uns ein in diesen Satz wie in einen warmen Mantel
helper.rol_van_god: God is a co-sufferer/Helper, not the primary Subject of the narrative drive.

tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Death and cynicism are treated as the ultimate, almost insurmountable horizon.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The historical/theological program of Jesus' death.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: Jesus/God's Passion.
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The primary program (the preacher's search for meaning) uses the secondary program (Jesus) merely as a symbolic reinforcement for the existential choice.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: Existential Need → Meaning/Solidarity → The Doubting Self
actantieel_schema_visualisatie.subject_naar_object: The Preacher → Holding on to Love

voorbeelden_god_subject: Gott will die Erlösung der Welt
In dem Tod Jesu protestiert Gott
voorbeelden_mens_subject: Ich halte mich an die Wahrheit

voorbeelden: Ich kann mich da nicht entscheiden
Was kümmert es mich, ob ich glauben kann
Ich maße mir nicht an, es vollkommen zu verstehen

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is a 'Recruitment' of the will. It focuses on the human struggle to want to believe or to choose love despite the lack of 'Pouvoir' (power/proof).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (Death) to ~S2 (Rejecting easy answers) to S1 (Choosing solidarity as a 'crazy sentence').
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is not found in God's act, but in the human decision to 'hold on' to a metaphor.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Very high; S2 (Death) is the dominant reality that the sermon struggles to overcome.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: Though it avoids 'legalistic' moralism, it falls into 'existential moralism' where the human subject's act of 'holding on' and 'imitating' (exemplarism) is the engine of the sermon.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Ich halte mich an diesen Versuch, die Liebe gegen den Tod zu setzen.
Diese junge Frau hat den Gott nachgeahmt, der in seinem Knecht aus Nazaret...

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Gut ist für mich die Leidenschaft Gottes, die in Jesus sichtbar wurde.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Simone Weil is the primary actant of the sermon; Jesus is interpreted through her radicalism rather than vice versa.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: God is the one who holds onto us when we cannot hold onto the 'crazy sentences'.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Burden of maintaining faith through willpower.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Soteriology is reduced to a psychological 'warm coat' (Mantel) we put on ourselves.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon is rhetorically beautiful but actantially fragmented between historical exegesis and modern biography.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'God wants redemption' and 'I see nothing of it'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Die Liebe geht nicht verloren... daran kann ich mich halten.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: None; the human must find their own motivation (Vouloir).

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as an existential appeal where the human 'I' is the Subject seeking the Object of 'Meaning' using Jesus as a Helper/Example.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The preacher's 'holding on' is the primary action.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make God's 'holding on' to the world the primary action.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'I hold on to the truth,' use 'The Truth of God's love holds me fast, even when I doubt.'

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: Hearer as the one who must 'not decide' or 'stutter'.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize that the 'warm coat' of the Gospel is given, not woven by our own speaking.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on how the Resurrection is an act of God's power (Pouvoir) that overcomes the human inability to believe.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (Death/Cynicism) is already very strong.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The sermon correctly identifies the 'Heavy Opponent' but lacks a 'Stronger Subject' (God) to defeat it.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: The secondary program (Ethics/Simone Weil) overshadows the primary (Soteriology).
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Christ's death as the objective ground (Program 1) which then enables Simone Weil's sacrifice (Program 2).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A deeply poetic and honest meditation that captures the modern struggle with faith, but structurally places the burden of 'salvation' on the sincerity of human empathy.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the 'I' creates authenticity; actantially, it creates anthropocentrism.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis of Caiaphas is strong, but the application bypasses the 'substitutionary' logic of the text.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that despite the word 'God' appearing, the 'Subject' slot is almost exclusively occupied by the human ego.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of 'Existential Exemplarism'.
